title.narrative: Emergency Psychosocial Support and Education for Internally Displaced Children in Bangui

description.narrative:
1) 3 Child Friendly Spaces are established and operational in the 3 IDP camps or communities providing psychosocial support to 8,000 children.
2) 200 children and adolescents affected by the crisis (separated and unaccompanied children, children associated with armed groups, victims of gender based violence) benefit from specific community based support.
3) 1,000 children and adolescents participate in group discussions and awareness sessions to promote equality, inclusion and to overcome gender communal divisions, to prevent further violence.
4) 1,000 members of local community organizations are informed and trained to increase their resilience mechanisms in dealing with contextual threats in the intervention areas.
5) A monitoring, reporting and referral system for cases of grave violations against children to be put in place and made functional. It will provide rapid response and support to victims, reporting, and referral to other relevant services (health, psychosocial support, education, etc.).
6) Capacity building of local teams, community volunteers and community based networks. This will enable them to provide efficient support to children, equip them with adequate psychosocial knowledge and equip them to prevent and respond to protection incidents. It will also develop strong community participation to ensure long term durability of the project.

To strengthen child protection mechanisms for displaced children and adolescents in camps in Bangui, through setting up Child Friendly Spaces and support centers to provide support to the vulnerable children, as well as to identify special needs and to respond through psychosocial support and appropriate referral paths.
